main event: A civilian observed a small, pear-shaped, blue-white object moving in a straight line to the east-southeast for approximately 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object's movement was observed in relation to the stars behind it.
The observation took place on a bright moonlit night.
The observer was a Sergeant from Headquarters Air Defense Command, who was determined to be a reliable witness.
The preliminary analysis suggested the object may have been a reflection of the almost full moon off a surface such as a reservoir.
Weather data showed clear skies and no other reported aerial activity in the area.
witnesses: Sergeant from Headquarters Air Defense Command
